repnme.cdata!:
Mongolia - Education for all Fast-Track
            Initiative (EFA-FTI) Catalytic Trust Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education for all
            Fast-Track Initiative (EFA-FTI) Catalytic Trust Fund Project
            for Mongolia were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Grantee
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: low income countries, that are
            experiencing severe financial constraints and are able to
            afford little more in education than the payment of salaries
            and other recurrent costs, can often benefit greatly from
            the infusion of short-term grant funds for financing capital
            expenditures and other development expenses. Connecting the
            delivery of services to traditional ways of doing things
            (for example, putting kindergartens in movable buildings
            within nomad communities) can often make these services more
            attractive, affordable, and culturally acceptable. The use
            of a consultative framework like the education donors'
            consultative mechanism, which was effectively used as a
            steering group during the first three years of the project,
            can be a good way to bring donors together and to promote
            cooperation and interagency planning. In designing outcome
            indicators for an intervention or set of interventions like
            those financed by the EFA-FTI grant, it is critical that the
            indicators be linked causally to project inputs, processes,
            and outputs so that there is no question about attribution.
            Innovative, eco-friendly building designs are becoming
            increasingly available in a variety of climactic zones
            (include Mongolia's, characterized by cold and windy
            conditions) and need to be promoted as a way of saving
            resources and improving air and water quality. Regarding
            school construction, given the short construction season in
            Mongolia due to weather limitations, as well as booming
            demand, future projects need to plan carefully, assess local
            capacity, and supervise implementation closely.

repnme.cdata!:
Mongolia - Education for all Fast-Track
            Initiative (EFA FTI) Catalytic Trust Fund Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall Education for all Fast-Track
            Initiative (EFA FTI) Catalytic Trust Fund Project for
            Mongolia goal is to ensure universal completion of basic
            education and to close the gender gap and rural/urban gap in
            enrollment and school completion by 2015. The restructuring
            is intended to: a) extend the project closing date by 12
            months from December 31, 2012 to December 31, 2013; and b)
            adjust the results framework indicators and targets to
            reflect the extension periods, facilitate measuring progress
            towards achieving the Project Development Objective (PDO)
            and track the required core indicators. The extension was
            requested by the Mongolian Ministry of Finance in a letter
            dated October 25, 2012. The extension is necessary to
            complete the construction of a school complex in the
            Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, which is a high priority
            educational intervention for the government. The changes to
            the results framework have been discussed and agreed with
            the Ministry of Education and Science during the course of
            project supervision.

repnme.cdata!:
Mongolia - Education for all Fast-Track
            Initiative (EFA FTI) Catalytic Trust Fund Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall Education for all Fast-Track
            Initiative (EFA FTI) Catalytic Trust Fund Project for
            Mongolia goal is to ensure universal completion of basic
            education and to close the gender gap and rural/urban gap in
            enrollment and school completion by 2015. The closing date
            for the project will be extended from December 31, 2010
            until December 31, 2012. The Mongolian EFA FTI Project has
            been implemented well and has contributed to improving
            access to and completion of basic education (primary and
            secondary education), with particular attention to rural
            areas; improving the quality of basic education; expanding
            access to pre-school education in rural areas: and improving
            project management. The entire $29.4 million grant fund was
            transferred to the special account in tranches between 2007
            and 2010. As of September 30, 2010, 87 percent of the total
            grant was disbursed, with only 13 percent remaining. The
            construction of a new school not only will improve the
            teaching and learning environment, but also enables an
            extension of instructional time and improve learning outcomes.
